info.title: SealMetrics API
info.description:
SealMetrics provides **first-party, cookie-free analytics** that deliver accurate marketing attribution and conversion tracking. Our powerful REST API gives you complete access to your analytics data:

- **Real-time analytics** with accurate traffic and conversion data
- **ROAS tracking** to measure return on ad spend across all channels
- **Conversion & microconversion tracking** for complete funnel visibility
- **UTM-based attribution** with multi-touch journey analysis
- **Offline conversion support** for phone calls, CRM events, and more
- **GDPR-compliant** first-party tracking without cookies

## Getting Started

1. [Create a SealMetrics account](https://my.sealmetrics.com/register)
2. Obtain your API credentials from the dashboard
3. Authenticate using the `/auth/login` endpoint
4. Use the Bearer token for all subsequent requests

## Developer Resources

- [API Documentation](https://docs.sealmetrics.com/api)
- [Implementation Guides](https://docs.sealmetrics.com/api/implementation-guide)
- [Rate Limits & Best Practices](https://docs.sealmetrics.com/api/appendix/understanding-rate-limits)

## Support

Need help? Contact us at [support@sealmetrics.com](mailto:support@sealmetrics.com)

get.description: Returns 200 if the service is running
Returns 200 if the service is ready to accept traffic
Detailed health status with all dependency checks. In production, requires authentication.

schema.description: Health check token for production access

parameters.description: Health check token for production access

403.description: Access denied in production without authentication

get.description: Returns the minified tracker.js with embedded account ID and token

head.description: HEAD request to check if tracker is available for account

get.description:
Get key performance indicators for the admin dashboard.

Includes:
- Account and user counts
- Traffic metrics (today and this month)
- Revenue metrics (MRR/ARR)
- API usage stats

List all accounts with pagination and filters.

Supports filtering by:
- Search term (ID or name)
- Plan tier
- Active status

Supports sorting by:
- created_at (default)
- name
- plan_tier
- pageviews_30d

Get detailed information for a specific account.

Includes:
- Account info
- Associated domains
- Associated users
- Usage stats (last 30 days)

List all users with pagination and filters.

Supports filtering by:
- Search term (email or name)
- Role
- Active status
- 2FA enabled status

Supports sorting by:
- created_at (default)
- email
- name
- last_login_at

List billing information for all accounts.

Includes summary with:
- MRR/ARR totals
- Subscription counts by status
- Account counts by plan tier

List API usage summary by account.

Shows:
- Total requests
- Success/error counts
- Average response time
- Unique IPs

get.summary: Get detailed API usage for an account
get.description:
Get detailed API usage for a specific account.

Includes:
- Request counts and averages
- Endpoint breakdown
- Recent errors

post.description:
Start an impersonation session for a specific account.

This allows the superadmin to view the dashboard as if they were a user
of the specified account. The session expires after 2 hours.

Note: Impersonation sessions are NOT logged in audit logs.

delete.description: End an active impersonation session.

post.summary: Clean up old API usage logs
post.description:
Clean up API usage logs older than the retention period.

Default retention is 90 days.

schema.title: Response Cleanup Api Usage Logs Api V1 Admin Cleanup Api Usage Post

post.description: Clean up expired impersonation sessions.

schema.title: Response Cleanup Sessions Api V1 Admin Cleanup Sessions Post

The webhook will receive events of the specified types when they occur.
A secret key will be generated automatically for HMAC signature verification.

post.description:
Send a test webhook to verify the endpoint is correctly configured.

The test payload will include a `test: true` flag in the metadata.
On first successful test, the endpoint will be marked as verified.

Rotate the webhook secret key.

The previous secret will remain valid for 24 hours to allow
for graceful migration without downtime.

**Important**: The new secret is only shown once in this response.
Store it securely.

List insights for an account.

Returns paginated list of AI-generated insights with filtering options.
By default, shows only active (non-dismissed, non-expired) insights.
Locked insights (from Growth-only categories) are shown with limited info
to encourage upgrading.

parameters.name: insight_type

schema.description: Filter by insight type(s): anomaly, opportunity, trend, alert, health
schema.title: Insight Type

parameters.description: Filter by insight type(s): anomaly, opportunity, trend, alert, health

parameters.name: severity

schema.description: Filter by severity: green, yellow, red
schema.title: Severity

parameters.description: Filter by severity: green, yellow, red

get.description:
Get insight summary for notifications/badges.

Returns counts of insights by severity and read status.
Useful for showing notification badges in the UI.

List insights grouped by a common attribute.

This is useful for reducing noise when there are many similar insights.
For example, if there are 10 "traffic drop" insights over the past week,
they can be grouped into a single entry showing:
- Total count of insights
- Unread count
- Combined economic impact
- Most severe severity level
- Most recent insight details
- List of affected entities

Group by options:
- source_rule: Group by the detection rule that generated the insight
- insight_type: Group by type (anomaly, opportunity, etc.)
- related_entity: Group by the entity affected (e.g., product, channel)

parameters.name: group_by

schema.description: Field to group by: source_rule, insight_type, or related_entity
schema.title: Group By

parameters.description: Field to group by: source_rule, insight_type, or related_entity

get.description: Get a single insight by ID.

patch.description:
Dismiss an insight.

Dismissed insights won't appear in the default list view.

post.description:
Submit feedback on an insight.

Feedback helps improve the quality of future insights.

Archive expired and old dismissed insights.

This endpoint:
1. Archives insights where expires_at has passed
2. Archives dismissed insights older than 7 days
3. Deletes archives older than 12 months

Requires admin role. Should be called daily via cron job.

get.description:
Get LENS notification settings for an account.

Returns the current configuration for email alerts and analysis frequency.

patch.description:
Update LENS notification settings for an account.

Configure when to receive email alerts:
- notify_on_red: Receive alerts for critical issues (recommended)
- notify_on_yellow: Receive alerts for warnings
- notify_on_green: Receive alerts for opportunities

Email recipients must be valid email addresses.

get.description:
Get current chat question usage for an account.

Returns the number of questions used, limit based on plan,
bonus questions from purchased packs, and remaining questions.

post.description:
Increment chat question usage and check if limit exceeded.

Call this when a user sends a message to the chat.
Returns whether the question was allowed or if the limit was exceeded.

get.description: List all available rule templates.
Get template details including config schema.
List all custom rules for an account.

post.description: Create a new custom rule.

Parse a natural language prompt into a structured rule definition.

This endpoint does NOT save the rule - use POST /prompt to create it.
Use this for preview/validation before creating the rule.

Create a new prompt-based custom rule.

The parsed_definition should come from a previous /parse call.

Parse and test a prompt without saving.

Returns what would be detected with current data.

get.description: Get a specific custom rule.

delete.description: Delete a custom rule.

post.description: Toggle a custom rule on/off.

Test a custom rule without consuming quota.

Returns what would be detected with current data.

get.description:
Get a human-readable explanation of a rule.

Works for both template-based and prompt-based rules.

post.description:
Generate a new report.

If a report for the same period already exists and is ready, returns it.
Otherwise, generates a new report (this may take a few seconds).

For weekly reports, defaults to the last completed week (ending Sunday).
For monthly reports, defaults to the last completed month.

get.description:
Get the latest report of a given type.

Returns the most recent ready report for the account.
If no report exists, returns 404.

Setup BigQuery integration for an account.

**Security:**
- The Service Account JSON is encrypted at rest using AES-256-GCM
- Only the account owner can configure this integration
- The Service Account should have minimal BigQuery permissions

**Required Service Account Permissions:**
- bigquery.datasets.create (only for initial setup)
- bigquery.datasets.get
- bigquery.tables.create
- bigquery.tables.updateData
- bigquery.tables.get
- bigquery.jobs.create

**Process:**
1. Validates the Service Account JSON
2. Encrypts and stores credentials
3. Creates the BigQuery dataset and tables
4. Returns integration details

**Note:** Data is NOT automatically synced after setup.
Use the sync endpoint or wait for scheduled sync.

get.description:
Get BigQuery integration configuration for an account.

Returns null if no integration is configured.

schema.title: Response Get Bigquery Integration Api V1 Integrations Bigquery Get

patch.description:
Update BigQuery integration settings.

Can update:
- sync_frequency: How often to sync (hourly, daily, manual)
- data_types: Which data to sync
- is_active: Enable/disable sync
- backfill_days: Historical data range

delete.description:
Delete BigQuery integration.

**Important:** This only removes the integration configuration from SealMetrics.
Data already synced to BigQuery is NOT deleted - the client retains full
ownership of their BigQuery data.

post.description:
Create BigQuery dataset and tables.

This creates the actual BigQuery resources using the stored credentials.
Must be called after the integration is configured.

**Creates:**
- Dataset (if not exists)
- All tables based on configured data_types
- sync_metadata table for transparency

**Note:** Without valid BigQuery credentials, this will use a mock
client that logs operations but doesn't connect to BigQuery.

Trigger a manual sync to BigQuery.

**Parameters:**
- date_from: Start date (defaults to last sync - 2 days, or backfill_days ago)
- date_to: End date (defaults to today)

**Returns:**
- sync_id: Unique identifier for this sync operation
- tables: Results per table (rows synced, bytes)
- total_rows: Total rows synced
- duration_seconds: How long the sync took

**Note:** Without valid BigQuery credentials, this will use a mock
client that logs operations but doesn't actually sync data.

Trigger a backfill sync for historical data.

Backfill syncs are processed in chunks to avoid timeouts and
provide better progress visibility. Failed chunks are tracked
and can be retried.

**Parameters:**
- date_from: Start date for backfill (required)
- date_to: End date for backfill (required)
- chunk_days: Days per chunk (1-30, default 7)

**Returns:**
- sync_id: Unique identifier for this backfill operation
- tables: Results per table (rows synced, bytes)
- total_chunks: Number of date chunks processed
- failed_chunks: List of any chunks that failed

**Note:** Backfill is limited to 365 days maximum.
For larger historical imports, run multiple backfills.

Retry a failed sync operation.

Uses the same date range from the original sync.
Only failed or partial syncs can be retried.

get.description:
Get BigQuery sync history.

Shows all sync operations with details:
- Date range synced
- Tables and rows synced
- Duration and status
- Any errors that occurred

This provides full transparency into what data has been sent to BigQuery.
Get detailed information about a specific sync operation.

Get the schema for all BigQuery tables that SealMetrics creates.

**Star Schema Design:**
- fact_* tables: Fact tables with metrics and dimensions
- dim_* tables: Dimension tables for lookups and context
- sync_metadata: Auditing and transparency

This is useful for:
- Understanding what data will be synced
- Building custom queries in BigQuery
- Documentation purposes

List all available LLM providers and their configuration requirements.

Returns information about each provider including:
- Whether an API key is required
- Default models for simple/complex/critical rules
- Documentation links

Get LLM settings for an account.

Returns null if no custom settings are configured (uses default DeepSeek local).

schema.title: Response Get Llm Settings Api V1 Settings Llm Get

post.description:
Create or update LLM settings for an account.

**Security:**
- API keys are encrypted at rest using AES-256-GCM
- Only account admins can configure LLM settings

**Providers:**
- `deepseek_local`: Self-hosted via Ollama (default, no API key needed)
- `deepseek_cloud`: DeepSeek Cloud API (requires API key)
- `anthropic`: Anthropic Claude (requires API key)
- `openai`: OpenAI GPT (requires API key)
- `gemini`: Google Gemini (requires API key)

**Model Overrides:**
You can optionally override the default models for each complexity level:
- `model_simple`: For simple, single-metric insights
- `model_complex`: For multi-factor analysis
- `model_critical`: For high-stakes decisions

If not specified, default models are used based on the provider.

patch.description:
Partially update LLM settings.

Only provided fields are updated. Omitted fields retain their current values.

delete.description:
Delete LLM settings for an account.

After deletion, the account reverts to using the default provider (DeepSeek local).

post.description:
Test connection to an LLM provider.

**Usage:**
1. Test with a new API key before saving:
   ```json
   {"provider": "anthropic", "api_key": "sk-ant-..."}
   ```

2. Test the stored configuration:
   ```json
   {"provider": "anthropic"}
   ```
   (provide account_id query param to use stored key)

3. Test local Ollama (no key needed):
   ```json
   {"provider": "deepseek_local"}
   ```

Returns connection status, latency, and available model information.

PlanTier.title: PlanTier
PlanTier.description:
Subscription plan tiers.

SealMetrics offers two paid plans:
- Guard: €399/month/account - Essential protection and analytics
- Growth: €599/month/account - AI-powered insights with Lens features

Both plans include unlimited events, unlimited users, and 24-month data retention.
Additional accounts can be added at €300/month each.

Supports both positive filters (field: value) and negative filters (field_not: value).
Values can be single strings or arrays for IN/NOT IN operations.
